ZERO.description:
An example Turing Machine (TM) to get you started
Here, you have a TM that writes 0 to the tape and moves right.

We would rather want to write 0 and stay on the same spot. Add states and/or state rules to go back left after having written the 0.

MOVE_R.description: Write a TM that only moves right and does not modify anything on the tape.

MOVE_L.description: Write a TM that only moves left and does not modify anything on the tape.

ZERO_2.description: Write 0 on both tapes and return the head at its initial position.

COPY_TO_MAIN.description:
Copy the content of the Working tape to the Main tape.

INPUT: arbitraty bit string on the Working tape.

COPY_TO_WORK.description:
Copy the content of the Main tape to the Working tape.

INPUT: arbitrary bit string on the Main tape.

ADD1.description:
Add 1 to a number written in binary form (modulo 256)

INPUT: number between 0 and 255 in binary form.

SUB1.description:
Subtract 1 from a number written in binary form (modulo 256)

INPUT: number between 0 and 255 in binary form.

NEG.description:
Negate a binary number (Two's complement) in place

INPUT: number between -128 and 127 in binary form.
